DOC.brief_summary: Hypothesis : Volunteers vitamin D insufficiency ( serum 25 ( OH ) D 25-50 nmol/L ) give intermediate high dose vitamin D supplement ( 2,000 5,000 IU per day ) increase production anti-bacterial peptide interleukin-1 , decreased production pro-inflammatory cytokine , increase production regulatory cytokine enhance T- B-cell response tetanus vaccine compare vitamin D insufficient subject give low dose vitamin D supplement ( 400 IU per day ) .
DOC.brief_title: Assessment Vitamin D Supplementation Immune Function
DOC.detailed_description: Specific Aim 1 : Determine high dose vitamin D supplement decrease production proinflammatory increase production regulatory cytokine chemokines innate immune cell stimulate ex vivo . Specific Aim 2 : Determine high dose vitamin D supplement decrease serum marker inflammation increase serum cellular level defensive molecule ( e.g. , cathelicidin ) . Specific Aim 3 : Determine high dose vitamin D supplement decrease blood level proinflammatory T-helper type 1 ( Th1 ) Th17 cell increase level anti-inflammatory T-regulatory ( Treg ) Th2 cell . Specific Aim 4 : Determine high dose vitamin D supplement increase antigen specific T cell B cell response tetanus vaccination .
DOC.criteria: Age 2049 ( men ) 2045 ( woman ) BMI 18.530 Serum 25OH Vitamin D 2550 nmol/L Pregnant nursing woman Daily smoker Anemia ( Hgb < 12 mg/dL woman < 13 mg/dL men ) determine initial visit Any report diagnosis disease chronic condition may affect vitamin D absorption cystic fibrosis , celiac disease , surgical removal part stomach intestine , form liver disease Diagnosis hyper parathyroidism chronic granulomatous disease , increase risk hypercalcemia . Planned travel location either altitude latitude would result significant vitamin D synthesis study period . Not previously vaccinate TT , vaccinate within five year Use steroids antibiotic within past 4 week Current use nutritional supplement may alter immune function omega 3 fatty acid supplement Current use antiinflammatory anticonvulsion medication Self report history significant adverse response previous vaccination
